How To Reach Pretoria

Planning A Trip To Pretoria? Here are some guidelines on how to reach Pretoria

Pretoria is a peaceful city renowned for its acclaimed for its majestic colonial architecture and towering structures. The capital city of South Africa, this administrative hub attracts tourists with its vibrant people, culture, refreshing gardens, and illustrious past. The fastest way to reach this beautiful city of Pretoria is by boarding a flight to the O.R. Tambo International Airport. This airport offers many flights to international as well as local metropolitans. Let us read on to know how to get to Pretoria through the available means of transport.

By Air

Photograph by https://www.brandsouthafrica.com

O.R. Tambo International Airport is the closest airport to Pretoria, located approximately 55 km away from the central area of the city. This airport operates flights to some of the significant parts of the country, such as Bloemfontein, Durban, Cape Town, and Port Elizabeth. Foreign powerhouses such as London, Frankfurt, and Paris regularly ply flights to the O.R. Tambo International Airport, forming the quickest means to reach Pretoria. From the airport, tourists can resort to transport mechanisms such as taxis, cabs, or buses to get to their destination.

By Rail

Photograph by https://www.travelground.com

Pretoria enjoys excellent connectivity to other prime centres of South Africa, thanks to its internal rail system and the Gautrain services. Located about 5 km away from the heart of the city, Pretoria Railway Station regularly operates lavish blue trains to cities such as Cape Town and Johannesburg. Additionally, the Metrorail system of Pretoria also provides excellent connectivity to neighboring areas such as Midran and Centurion. Some of the other major cities that these trains travel to include Nelspruit, Polokwane, and Kimberly.

By Road

Photograph by https://www.brandsouthafrica.com

The national highway roads of South Africa pass through Pretoria, providing perfect links to other parts of the country. Some of the major national highways that link Pretoria to other regional locations include N1, N3, N4, and N14. Local transport systems regularly operate buses from Pretoria to other hubs of South Africa. However, the best way to travel to Pretoria is to hire a cab and ply through the N1 national highway.

Getting around Pretoria

Photograph by https://ashtonstours.com

Pretoria has many shuttle buses that frequently travel to Johannesburg at a minimal price. A decent tracery of internally running buses makes exploring the city a delight. Local taxis are readily available at essential points such as Van der Walt Street, Church Square, and Paul Kruger Street. The internal rail system of Pretoria offers a wide range of options, such as lavish Blue Trains, Gautrain, commuter rail system. Gautrain feeder buses and minibus taxis are constant throughout the city. However, the best way to coast through Pretoria is on a comfortable hired cab.
